clues.clue: This infamous local personality became a campus legend dwelling in the university's underground tunnel system.
The last time the Badgers went to the Rose Bowl.
The only library on campus that requires a wiscard to enter.
With multiple national championships, this UW-Madison program stands as the school's most successful NCAA sport.
The current chair of the Computer Sciences department.
This linear data structure follows the Last In, First Out (LIFO) principle.
This algorithm repeatedly swaps adjacent elements until the list is sorted.
This greedy algorithm is used to find the minimum spanning tree of a connected, undirected graph.
This is the name of the optimal path-finding algorithm that uses a heuristic.
This is the term for extending the size of a hashset and changing the key matches.
Developed by the Mozilla Foundation, this open-source browser got its fiery name from the red panda.
"Secure" yourself a terminal connection to a remote computer with this three-letter command.
This framework, named for a subatomic particle, is the "energy" powering Atom, Visual Studio Code, Discord, and Slack.
This cloud computing service is known for its ability to "elastically" adapt to demand.
Unlike full VMs, these lightweight virtualized environments share an operating system kernel with their host.
Used in devices from smartphones to credit card chips, this programming language runs on over 56 billion devices globally.
Developed in just 10 days by Brendan Eich at Netscape in 1995, this scripting language was originally called Mocha before becoming the cornerstone of web interactivity.
This "crabby" programming language is known for its breakout feature, the borrow checker.
Known for its unforgiving type system, this "objective" language used at Jane Street has been dubbed "developer rights management."
Developed at Bell Labs in 1969 by Ken Thompson, this short-lived language served as the direct predecessor to C.
The first video uploaded to this site was titled "Me at the zoo" and featured co-founder Jawed Karim.
In 1995, Amazon sold its first item, which was one of these physical objects.
The first SMS text message ever sent wished the receiver a Merry this.
The first computer mouse, invented by Douglas Engelbart in 1964, was carved from this material.
Grace Hopper popularized the term "debugging" after finding one of these insects trapped in a relay of the Harvard Mark II computer.
Under U.S. legislation threatening a ban unless its China-based owner divests, this short-video platform's American operations are set to be acquired by which company?
With thousands of satellites in low Earth orbit, this network expanded global broadband and began testing direct-to-cell service with carriers.
To cut e-waste and standardize charging, the EU mandated that most new phones, tablets, and small electronics sold after late 2024 use this connector.
This Bay Area company recently admitted to running over the "Mayor of 16th street", KitKat (rip).
This Himalayan nation launched an official Discord server to share updates, gather feedback, and engage citizens.

final.clue: This data structure "balances" itself such that node heights differ by at most 1, maintaining logarithmic time search, insertion, and deletion operations.
